Class Trafficsystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • Trafficsystem

  • public class Trafficsystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Trafficsystem is a system that combines the classes Fordon, Light, Lane. Trafficsystem runs the whole simulation but needs to be told what to do and when.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Fordon> D1
      D1 is the end state of vehicles that finished to trafficsystem and had dest = 1.
      java.util.ArrayList<Fordon> D2
      D2 is the end state of vehicles that finished the trafficsystem and had dest = 2.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trafficsystem(int vehicle, int r0, int r1, int period, int greenTime, int greenTime2, int intensity)
      creates a trafficSystem, the user is allowed to enter the length of lanes greentimes and light intervals to study a traffic situation.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createBike()
      Creates a Bike and puts it in the last position of the lane.
      void createCar()
      Creates a car and puts it in the last position of the lane.
      void print()
      Prints the representation of the traffic situation using the Lane.toString method.
      void printStatistics()
      Prints the statistics that has been calculated this far.
      void step()
      Steps every object in the right order: Lights, Lanes and then it uses createBike or createCar.

    • Field Detail

      • D1

        public java.util.ArrayList<Fordon> D1
        D1 is the end state of vehicles that finished to trafficsystem and had dest = 1.

      • D2

        public java.util.ArrayList<Fordon> D2
        D2 is the end state of vehicles that finished the trafficsystem and had dest = 2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trafficsystem

        public Trafficsystem(int vehicle,
             int r0,
             int r1,
             int period,
             int greenTime,
             int greenTime2,
             int intensity)
        creates a trafficSystem, the user is allowed to enter the length of lanes greentimes and light intervals to study a traffic situation.
        Parameters:
        vehicle - is 1 if we want create a system using cars and is 2 if we use Bikes.
        r0 - the length of lane r0.
        r1 - the length of lane r1 and lane r2, since they have the same length.
        period - the time interval of the lights.
        greenTime - as long as the time counter is less than greenTime the light will be green (the straight lane).
        greenTime2 - same as greenTime except this is the greentime for the second light (the left turn lane).
        intensity - the createCar and createBike method uses intensity to know how often a vehicle should be added to the system, 1 vehicle every X step. For example intensity = 3 and 90 ticks would spawn about 30 cars. since it uses Random it's mostly not axactly 30.

    • Method Detail

      • createCar

        public void createCar()
        Creates a car and puts it in the last position of the lane. Using Random to make the simulation more real. The intensity of car spawn is entered by the user but since it's random it will almost never be exact. Intensity works as follows, intensity x = 3, a car will be spawned approximately every 3 seconds.

      • createBike

        public void createBike()
        Creates a Bike and puts it in the last position of the lane. Using Random to make the simulation more real. The intensity of bike spawn is entered by the user but since it's random it will almost never be exact. Intensity works as follows, intensity x = 3, a bike will be spawned approximately every 3 seconds.

      • step

        public void step()
        Steps every object in the right order: Lights, Lanes and then it uses createBike or createCar. If a vehicle exits lanes: r1 or r2, it will be put in its end state(D1 or D2) depending on which destination it has.

      • printStatistics

        public void printStatistics()
        Prints the statistics that has been calculated this far. Average time, Longest time, vehicles left, and how many vehicles went straight/left.

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the representation of the traffic situation using the Lane.toString method.
